author: Saumya Vaishampayan
title: Bond Investors Face Shrinking Rewards From Emerging Market Currencies
text:
The dollar’s revival is curbing the appeal of a popular investment in emerging markets.
The excess yield investors can earn by holding local currency emerging-market bonds—compared with such bonds denominated in dollars—has shriveled to zero in recent weeks. Emerging-market investors earned higher returns in local-currency bonds than U.S. dollar bonds last year, in part because they benefited from higher yields.
